title: GH Mumm vs. Beau Joie Tasting
description:
Join us on Wednesday, June 18, from 4–7 PM at Whispering Vine South Creek for a side-by-side tasting of two distinct Champagne houses—GH Mumm and Beau Joie. From crisp, clean Brut styles to vibrant Rosés, this lineup highlights the character and craftsmanship of each producer.

Tasting Fee: $35 (Buy a bottle from the tasting and your fee is refunded)

Featured Wines:

• Beau Joie Brut Champagne – Crafted from 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay with zero dosage. Clean and crisp with citrus, apple, and a unique copper-encased bottle that keeps the chill.

• Beau Joie Brut Rosé – A 50/50 Pinot Noir and Chardonnay blend with a light, fresh profile, delicate fruit, and signature copper armor.

• GH Mumm Grand Cordon Brut – 91 pts, Wine Spectator & James Suckling. Creamy and elegant with peach, pineapple, vanilla, and brioche on a long, refined finish.

• GH Mumm Grand Cordon Rosé – Bright and fresh with wild red and black berries, forest fruit, and subtle spice, finishing with vibrant intensity.

Taste the contrast in styles and decide your favorite—buy a bottle and your tasting is free.
